updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Just a quick update to say that shipping of the books will commence the week of the 16th of November. Once the books are all on their way to you, we will be back in touch with estimated delivery dates.
Thanks again!

Hi everyone,

We'd like to thank you all for your patience and understanding regarding the delay to shipping. We will hopefully have more information to update you with very soon.

In other news, we thought you may be interested in our latest Kickstarter project. We are very excited to have teamed up with prolific visual effects studio , the team responsible for the iconic monsters of for their first narrative artbook .

Hi everyone,
The campaign has now ended, raising a fantastic total of £71,039! We are incredibly grateful to each and every one of you who has helped make this project a great success, thank you all so much for supporting Fran in making this book become a reality.

campaign.story:
Chers amis, amateurs et collectionneurs français : une campagne pour financer une édition française aura lieu sur une plateforme française dans quelques mois. La raison est simple, j'ai offert une belle part au texte en confiant certaines de mes œuvres à la plume de plusieurs auteurs,  pour revenir aux racines de ce qu'est un livre. Si vous souhaitez néanmoins ardemment participer à cette campagne ou au deux, d'abord merci infiniment, mais n'hésitez pas à attendre la version française si vous ne maîtrisez pas l'anglais. Je relève le défi de multiplier mes campagnes pour vous, par amour pour la langue de Baudelaire.
Forgotten Gods is the name of a painting I created in 2013, using the very same technique that promoted my work: graphite and gold leaf.
For this illustration, I was inspired by an encounter with a large deer during a stroll in the moonlit forest. Thriving on the emotion this sighting generated as I crossed tall iced over grass, surrounded by trees frozen in their exquisite prisons of crystal, my steps resonating in the mysterious silence of the night, I began dreaming of a tribute to the forest, the one I live in as well as the others, to nature and to its liveliness.
Of all my works, this image is undeniably the one that has travelled the most, all around the world, thus speaking to the souls of many cultures. Some symbols are powerful enough to cross our differences and bring us together to remind us that all of our civilizations have a common background.
Forgotten Gods is a door to Another World, this is what I wish for this book: that it will delight you and take you elsewhere for a stroll with me.
Forgotten Gods - 2013 - graphite, gold leaf and hydrangea petals on Arches paper
Yoann Lossel has exhibited his work in numerous galleries around the world, mainly in the United States. Award-winning artist, he is well known for his meticulous work combining graphite and gold leaf, legacy of the iconography that he cherishes such as the Italian Renaissance, the Symbolist, Pre-Raphaelites, Art Nouveau and Arts & Crafts movements. He currently lives in the legendary Broceliande forest in Brittany, France.
« Large landscapes fascinate me. I have always admired the strength that emerges from these visions.
 Before locking myself up into my workshop to represent these worlds, I am primarily a contemplative person searching for spaces, atmospheres, for a scope for imagination. I pay particular attention to what is "outside the frame", to this tiny nuance that transforms a space into a story. The timethat shapes the tree and forces it to adopt a posture. The erosion of the stone which distinguishes this very one from all the others. The wind that modifies the moor and forces the hawthorn to grow horizontally. These shrubs you identify in the hilltops of Devon or the paintings of Hokusai. I have a special affection for ruins: in these spaces,time becomes tangible, somewhere between civilization and wilderness.
To highlight the depth of these scenes, I opted for the use of gold leaf,which generates background by their way of reflecting light.
Thus are born twilights and dawns. »
www.yoannlossel.com
 (It starts with a “fundraising” that will take the project to fruition and elevate the rewards level of the final product. Then in 2021 the customized products will be delivered to each collector/purchaser)
 This book is a dream come true. I designed it as a jewel, a precious artifact, an object animated by a life of its own. I thank you from the bottom of my heart for your support and hope that together we will give rise to this project.
With my wife, Psyché, we worked on the creation of four levels of editing and finish. All are in high quality and wide format (24 / 32cm), including the first edition. Do not hesitate to take your time to choose. Each edition’s specifics are listed in the "Artifacts" section.

                                                                       I am a bookworm, I have been fondly collecting books for years, with a preference for first editions of the masters of the golden age of illustration (Rackham, Dulac, Nielsen, Robinson, Bauer, Doré, ...).
It’s with this love that I imagined Forgotten Gods, an art book which brings together my works from the past decade, with the wish to pay tribute to said period’s illustrations and carvings.
So, striving for sophistication and willing to work with the best materials, I was, for the creation of this work, joined by great artists and craftsmen, and guided by passion and ethics.
Forgotten Gods will include several sections and will address my technique, my inspirations, my collaborations, my relationship to art, my relationship to my muse and wife Psyché, as well as some of my early works. There will obviously be a selection of my works (best collected works), some yet unpublished, as well as close-ups to highlight some details. The layout and cover of the deluxe edition are obvious tributes to the 19th century and to the golden age of illustration.
The text is always important. With that in mind, we called upon the poetic pens of French and English-speaking authors we know and love to accompany my works, among whom: Gabriel McCaughry, Marc Nagels, Christophe Sudre, Arnaud Flici, Jean- Baptiste Garnier, Psyché Ophiuchus, Gwenael de Montfaucon and many more surprises...
Alan Lee does me the great honor of writing the preface of the book. Who better than the descendant of the masters of English illustration? I wish to once again send him my heartfelt thanks. I have dreamed as a child, and still dream as an adult, while admiring his illustrations. For me, as a contemporary artist, he has created a timeless art that remains dear to me. His is a formidable technique supporting a referenced background and a magnificent culture.
Alan Lee - Merlin
Florence Alibert, a French academic, signs the afterword for the book. Her book Cathédrales de poche (which translates into “Pocket cathedrals”), which describes William Morris’ perspectives on publishing, imposed itself on me during the conception of my book. Morris is one of the personalities who have been with me all along my artistic path and bringing a little bit of this great artist’s soul and intellectual through her intervention means the world to me.
The book will be printed by the printer Escourbiac, in France. His printing company is renowned and has won awards, and makes good use of both craftsmanship and ethics. They specialize in fine works and produce the artbooks of many artists and photographers in France. They received three "Cadrat d’or", a top distinction in the printing field in France. They are also respectful of the environment and their employees.
These pins have been specially designed for this kisckstarter!
However, as the pins are wide, they cannot be sent with the classic version book. Indeed, their size would risk damaging and scratching the book. This is why, in a desire to keep them available for purchase independently of other participations (which kickstarter does not allow), you can find these pins for purchase on my website : https://www.yoannlossel.com/shop
https://www.yoannlossel.com/shop
▼***Even if it does not appear in the right column, this award will be well numbered and signed, in a  limited series of 500 copies.***▼

 THE PRINTS
 CLASSICAL EDITION
(available in "First Magical Gathering" and "Noble West Forest")
Book specifics:
Wide format: 24 / 32cm - 9,44 / 12,6 inches
Gilded cover : If we reach the 60k stretch goal
136 pages using two different luxury papers, depending on the chapter: MUNKEN LYNX ROUGH 150 g / m² or MUNKEN PRINT CREAM 1.8 - 115 g / m². These are two elegant papers with a strong hand for better reading comfort, while true to the colors and contrasts of my images.
Printed by the Escourbiac printer, in France. Renowned and award-winning, respectful of the environment and of their employees.
Shipped by Editions Caurettes
THE DELUXE EDITION
(available in "Lustratio", limited to 500 copies)
Book specifics:
Wide format: 24 / 32cm
Black faux leather cover with gold stamping on the entire cover.
Golden edge
136 pages on two different luxury paper, depending on the chapter: MUNKEN LYNX ROUGH 150 g / m² or MUNKEN PRINT CREAM 1.8 - 115 g / m². These are two elegant papers with a strong hand for better reading comfort, while true to the colors and contrasts of my images.
18 illustrations inside with gold stamping to recreate the rendering of the original works
4 transparent pages with reproductions of my designs
Printed by the Escourbiac printer, in France. Renowned and award-winning, respectful of the environment and of their employees.
Shipped by us
 
THE COLLECTOR EDITION 
(available in"Celestial", limited to 200 copies)
Book specifics: similar to the Deluxe Edition
Box specifics:
Designed to protect the book, resistant and elegant
Cover gilded, with a reproduction of The Rise 
Covered with a sumptuous burgundy paper, strong and durable.
Burgundy satin ribbons
A space provided for the Prints
Certificate of authenticity
King of Gods 
(Handcraft luxury edition, limited to 9 copies):
This book is one of my personal dreams, a tribute to the sublime prints of the most prestigious editions. It is an Arts and Crafts approach, in the spirit of William Morris: the desire to bring together art and crafts in the service of an object in order to grant him a true spirit.
We worked with Belfëa, a longtime leather-crafting friend, to create an exceptional edition, a dream book that rediscovers the form of the most precious editions. It will be entirely handmade, down to the smallest detail.
I will make an original artwork on the title page of the 9 copies, using my favorite technique: graphite, gold leaf, white ink and hydrangea petals. This original art will be apart from the book, you can choose either to keep it within the book or to frame it as you wish.
The King of Gods will embrace a celestial aesthetic to depict the dreamlike approach behind its conception. Its stars will guide our hands during its making.
Specifics of the box:
Genuine leather, dyed, repelled and engraved by Belfëa, a renowned French leather craftsman. 
Gilded by my hand using 22k and 24k golds. Three different golds will enhance its patterns as well as silver leaf. 
Lock including a golden chain and wood, brass or deer antlers.
Book specifics:
Very large format: 37.5 / 50cm
Genuine leather cover, dyed, repelled and engraved by Belfëa, a renowned French leather craftsman. This cover will be gilded by my hand in 22k and 24k golds. Three different golds will enhance its patterns, as well as silver leaf.
Each illustration will be printed separately, pasted by hand and protected by a transparent sheet by my hand.
Double pages of support in Velin d'Arches paper, 250g / m²
Large format reproductions, pasted on Velin d'Arches: 29.7 / 42cm, printed on Hanemülhe Photo Rag 308g/m², a very beautiful high quality mat paper with superb reproduction of contrasts and colors.
30 illustrations will be enhanced with 22k or 24k gold leaf, depending on its color, by my hand.
All the designs surrounding the texts will be screenprinted in golden ink by my hand.
The book will be bound and sewn by my hand.
The book design will be slightly modified to offer the most beautiful form to this artefact, but its integrity will be preserved, and it will include all the elements of the other editions
PLAY

PLAY


 All items will be shipped in June 2021 (July for the "Celestial", and October for the "King of Gods"), so as to fine-tune the details of the book, check thetranslations and the consistency, include a few additional unpublished works and create other designs and drop caps to adorn each chapter of the text accordingly. Our goal is to offer you the most beautiful book possible, down to the smallest detail.
The covid-19 crisis should be behind us, which will allow us to ensure optimal delivery. We will keep you informed in case of unexpected changes or unforeseen developments because we work in a completely transparent way.
« First Magical Gathering » and « Noble West Forest » will be shipped by Éditions Caurette who have great experience in publishing and cheap shipment to buyers of high-quality print products. They have been publishing works of artists like Kim Jung Gi, Jesper Ejsing, Karl Kopinski, and many more, so we trust their competence and judgment.

                                  All other editions will be shipped by us, fortified by our experience in the field of luxury item shipping. Each product we send will be tracked. In case there is a problem, we will remain at your disposal to answer your questions through DMs on Kickstarter or by email.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have extensive experience in the field of books and publishing. I worked as an illustrator, model maker and graphic designer for years before dedicating myself to my work as an artist. With my wife, a photographer, we are professionally equipped and are used to operating the graphic chain.

Since 2012, I have sold and shipped more than 1,500 prints worldwide, including wide fragile formats, via my online store or my website. I have been working with galleries around the world, and I am also used to shipping works of art.

The layout of the book is almost finished, we nevertheless wish to work another eight months on it to refine the details, check the translations and the consistency, include some additional new works and create other designs and drop caps to adorn each chapter of the text. Our goal is to offer you the most beautiful book possible, down to the smallest detail.

The book will be printed by the printer Escourbiac, in France. His printing company is renowned and has won awards, and makes good use of both craftsmanship and ethics. They specialize in fine works and produce the artbooks of many artists and photographers in France. They received three "Cadrat d’or", a top distinction in the printing field in France. They are also respectful of the environment and their employees.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
"Important information: There will be at least a month's delay in shipping the books for two reasons related to world events. As I explained to you last month, my printer is in Paris and travel was very complicated because the French government had instituted a lockdown which has just ended. The second reason is related to the blockage of the Suez Canal and the difficulty of obtaining raw materials, especially paper. I apologize for this inconvenience."

Dear friends of the Forgotten Gods ☀️

updates.update_userinfo: ⭐The Rise print unlocked - Jasmine, orange blossom and bluebells ⭐
updates.update_content:
Dear friends of the Forgotten Gods ⭐

Important information: There will be at least a month's delay in shipping the books for two reasons related to world events. As I explained to you last month, my printer is in Paris and travel was very complicated because the French government had instituted a lockdown which has just ended. The second reason is related to the blockage of the Suez Canal and the difficulty of obtaining raw materials, especially paper. I apologize for this inconvenience.

Psyche will accompany me, we will choose the most beautiful faux leather for the luxury editions. We will also select the color of the bookmark, the color of the headbands and the color of the gilding for the different hot stamping. I am really looking forward to it.

Dear friends of the Forgotten Gods ⭐

Important information: The French government has extended lockdown measures across the country for a minimum of four weeks. Travel is very complicated, my printer's showroom is in Paris and his printing house in the south of France. I had several essential meetings this month, with the aim of selecting and ordering the materials (the faux leather) for the luxury edition cover, choosing the color of the headbands and choosing the color of the gilding for the book covers and for the edges of the luxury edition.
I will do my best to maintain the shipping schedule, but there might be a slight delay from the dates we announced. Please excuse me for the inconvenience, rest assured that I am giving all my heart and energy to this project. There will be no wasted time, I will work every day to improve the book during this time if I can't start printing as expected.

Dear Friends of the Forgotten Gods 🌟

We were finally able to organize the trip to visit Florence Alibert, Lecturer and Curator, who will write the afterword of the artbook and whose book Pocket Cathedral I mentioned in news # 19. It was a pleasure to exchange with her and to share our passion for our favorite artistic movements and in particular for the work and the thought of William Morris: it is rare to find an artistic personality with such a global thought and such a coherence in his approach to all areas of life. I invite you to read his essays and take an interest in the character of whom we often only know one side.

Dear friends of the Forgotten Gods,

The month of January was partly dedicated to the creation of goodies included with the different editions or acquired thanks to the goals reached. We were looking forward to receiving several deliveries before keeping you informed, the precious packages arrived yesterday and we were able to discover them with great joy.

Dear Friends of the Forgotten Gods 🌟

We have finally entered our new home in the woods. The move of our workspaces was particularly long, it was necessary to move my many presses, the old Psyche's cameras and our bulky and heavy various machines.

Dear friends of the Forgotten Gods 🌟

The last few weeks have been very busy.

First of all, I took advantage of the lockdown that we are experiencing again in France to write, to concentrate on what I want to say and to take time for reflection. The texts of the book must be neat.

Hello everyone 🌟

I hope that your passage through the gates of autumn is going well, here the forest is adorned with its most beautiful colors.

I'm pleased to  unveil my latest piece, Les Jardins de Nuit (Night's Gardens). This piece is part of a series I started with . When I met Psyche, we wrote a short story called Night and Dawn.  is an allegory of the gardens in the mind of Psyche (Night). I like to imagine that each of us could be represented by an enigmatic landscape. An entire universe as a mirror of our lives, with its trees, its diaphanous temple, its flowers, its ruins, its skies and its path to the stars⭐️.

Hello everyone 🌟
The last few weeks have been very busy, after a few days of vacation, I have had a lot of business management work. For a week now, I can focus again on the book project:
I am in contact with the enamel pins factory, the enamel pins will be manufactured in September.
I am currently designing a new Vignette frame for the layout, I would like the texts of the different chapters to be framed with different interlacing.

What can I tell you that I haven't told you already? 
⭐️ Thank you so much ⭐️ Repeating it does not reduce its value.
This campaign has been incredible from start to finish, crowning years of creation and months of preparation. We created this campaign like a dream, a stroll elsewhere during these sometimes less bright days. But as I told in my work "The Rise", there is light in the darkness, sometimes even its purest expression.

project_data.project_name: Forgotten Gods - The Art of Yoann Lossel

campaign.story:
PLAY

THE TEAM HAS BEEN HARD AT WORK. THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT
FIRST, EVERYONE GETS A FREE DIGITAL OR PHYSICAL POSTER AS A THANK YOU FOR GETTING US THIS FAR!
We couldn't have done this without you and the team is so excited for the chance to expand the universe of The Bone Herder and the world of Koatrom! For now, all art will be done by Tumo, Sam, and Morgan. All writing, for now, will be done by me, Zaire. :)
The team is very excited about the opportunity to expand the Universe of The Bone Herder and explore the world of Koatrom. We hope that you are too. Continue to share the campaign. None of this would be happening without each and everyone one of you! 
Stretch Goal List
 STRETCH GOAL BREAKDOWN - PART 1
$40,000 - Digital Wallpapers
Digital wallpapers illustrated by Tumo, Morgan, and Sam. They will be various ratios so they can fit on various screens. The pictures will be taken from concept art and further stretch goals
$50,000 - A Bone Herder's Tool Guide
This digital PDF details the Bone Herders tools and tricks with illustrations. What's a Bone Herder carry everyday? What's the purpose of each knife? What knife does Analleli use for a sandwich? Find out here.
$60,000 - A Conservationists Account of Koatrom’s Animals
An illustrated Digital PDF of the animals roaming Koatrom as noted by Jotan, a renowned conservationist of the country.
STRETCH GOAL BREAKDOWN - PART 2
$70,000 - Shadow Trackers Guide to Rare and Unseen Creatures
What creatures lurk in the shadows of Koatrom’s landscapes? Shadow Tracker Kytune regales the reader with tales of inhuman creatures in this illustrated guide
$80,000 - Tel'we's Short History of Koatrom
Digital PDF journal of various aspects of Koatrom’s history, culture, and lands as gathered by Tel’we, Koatrom's famous Nomadic Historian.
$120,000 - One shot Table Top Game
This is the stretchiest of stretch goals! Our moon landing. This would be one shot table top campaign that takes place in the world of Koatrom. We mostly added this one as a joke...unless....
AGAIN. THANK ALL OF YOU SO MUCH.
THE PROJECT
The Bone Herder is an Afropunk/Afrofuturistic fantasy horror comic that puts black characters at the center of the story. Often people of color are left out of fantasy worlds or forced into stereotypical roles. I'm not alone in my desire to see settings that extend beyond the familiarity of typical western stories. This project originated from Gail Simone's Comic School, which gave me the confidence to go forward with my idea. 
THE SQUAD
Ope, I am Zaire Lanier and I am a writer and narrative designer from the Midwest and I am the writer for The Bone Herder. The sequential artist is Tumo Mere from Botswana and the concept artist is Morgan Madeline. Morgan and Tumo are known for their work in the amazing SWORDSFALL UNIVERSE and more! Sam Willoughby came on to do additional art! Gary Kings and his sister, Harriet did the trailer and music respectively. Please give everyone follows and support!
Zaire: https://twitter.com/Zlanier21     
Tumo: https://twitter.com/ItsTumo  
Morgan: https://twitter.com/mormadillus
Sam: https://twitter.com/SamRWilloughby   
Gary: https://twitter.com/GaryJKings      
Harriet: https://twitter.com/Harriet_FerretE                                             
THE STORY
Every generation, a child is chosen to travel from village to village punishing wrong doers, by flaying their bones and burying them. Cass is the first to break the tradition, but in doing so breaks an ancient pact with the Flesh Folk. 
Preliminary sketch of the first page - Tumo Mere
Colored and Lettered First Page by Tumo Mere
THE WORLD 
The Bone Herder takes place in the mythical country of Koatrom and is inspired by pre-colonial Africa and Afropunk aesthetics. Why Afropunk? It is a battle cry against the norm and a baseline for something different. It isn't easily defined. Fantasy has been built on the shoulders of the Western ideals. While I enjoy it, it does have its issues, prejudices, and hurtful stereotypes. 
This is why  I am creating the world of The Bone Herder. It is for people, like me, that want to a reflection of themselves in the media they consume. My family tree and genealogy have no known origin. Africa is the framework for my existence and I feel an attachment and at times even a hole for a motherland I never knew. I imagine worlds and stories they might have once been a part of many, many years ago.  
I based the world around ancient African cities like Carthage and Kush. The ancient cities of Africa are a rich and diverse world. I have created my own mythos surrounding the mysterious and ancient Flesh Folk. 
While this story is a fantasy horror comic, I want to portray a strong and loving Black family. Cass's family will come strongly into play and we will see the impact that they have on her personhood as the story progresses. 
THE DUO
Anallelli Yosi - Cass's mentor and teacher. Analleli hates what she does, but knows it is necessary. She acts out of a sense of duty.
Analleli Concept Art - Morgan Thomas
Analleli by Tumo Mere
Cass Ilondyri - The forced apprentice to Analleli. She's vowed vengeance against her mentor and wants to end the practice. 
Older Cass by Tumo Mere
Cass Concept Art by Morgan
The Rewards
Logo Pin
Cass Button by Morgan
Analleli Button by Morgan
11x17 Print by Sam
THE SCRIPT
I wanted to show you guys a couple pages of the script :)
Page 1 of Script by Zaire
Page 2 of Script by Zaire
 THE BUDGET
ART 
About half of the funds are going directly to the artists. A lot of Kickstarter comics are already finished, but this isn't the case with Bone Herder. This is helping fund production of the comic, which goes towards myself, Tumo and Morgan, as well as Gary and his sister, who did the trailer and music. We all have already put in so much work and our skills deserve to be properly compensated.
I believe very strongly in paying artist fair rates for their time and skills. I saved and paid out of pocket for a first page and some concept art. They both believed in the script and decided to come on board for the project. I am trying to pay as close to professional rates as possible. Passion does not pay bills, as nice as that would be
PRINTING AND SHIPPING
The rest of the money goes towards printing, getting books bound, posters, etc. 
The Promise
We will be transparent with every step along the way. I promise to treat this comic and work respectfully. I wrote The Bone Herder with people like me in mind, who want to see more diverse characters and stories in comics. Fantasy has always catered to a Western bent. I want to help change that. I modeled the world partially off of ancient African cities like Carthage, Kush, and places that Africa influenced. The ancient world was more colorful than we were taught. 
I am excited about what I have put together with my team. I hope that you are too and that I will see you at the finish line!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first Kickstarter. I believe in the concept, but I haven't ever planned a project of this size before. My name isn't out there a ton, but there has been a lot of interest in the comic. 

I believe that my main risk would be attempting to large a scope for my first project. To mitigate this risk, I have been consulting friends and professionals that have run other successful Kickstarters. This ensures that I stay grounded. My artist are being paid through the Kickstarter and I want to make sure that they are able to be paid fairly on time. The rest of the money will be going towards shipping and production costs.

My challenges are mainly keeping an open line of communication with the team since we are working remotely. We have daily checkins and keep each other encouraged and on track.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! Quick check in, several folks have reached out about how to change your address for surveys. I’m going to post a picture below with instructions and also a link to the support page to do so.
Link: https://help.kickstarter.com/hc/en-us/articles/115005126894-How-do-I-provide-a-creator-with-my-shipping-address-and-reward-details-
Scroll down and look for how to change address. You should also be able to find the survey there if you still haven’t filled it out. The ability to change your address closes this coming Monday June 14.

The comics are here! They’ve arrived in 12 gigantic boxes and I have over 1300 books chilling in my living room. It’s a lot, but the books look gorgeous! I can’t wait for y’all to have them in hand :)
I am so excited and I planning to get these out within the next couple weeks. I am locking all address changes this Friday so make sure that you have to correct address on your survey.

Covers and almost there
Tumo just sent over the covers, the letterer sent over the properly formatted files, and I am about to send everything to the layout artist. The end is so close, I could cry! Here's some final images. Within the next week or two, you will have the digital comic in your inboxes.
At the same time, I will be sending over the files to the printer, which will take some time. Printing is still in flux because of the pandemic, BUT, you will be able to read it digitally, which is very exciting! Thank you all for being on this journey with me as we slowly come to the end. Once I get the books from the printer, I will immediately begin the long and arduous process of packing 1500 boxes!! :( :( lol.

updates.update_userinfo: The Finish Line is so Close!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!

Some good news and some bad news! Good news, everything is more or less done! Bad news, we had a formatting issue with the comic that resulted in a bad trim that looked very sloppy in physical form. So, we are reworking the comic to fit the correct sizing. This was an oversight on my part and I take full responsibility.

Hey everyone, just doing a quick check-in with some news. Bone Herder was picked up by Andrews McMeel for publication in Fall 2022! This Kickstarter was the catalyst. So, thank all of you for putting me on their radar. :) You guys will be the first people to get a small glimpse into the universe and I am very excited about it!! The book that will be published in 2022 will be a lot longer than 25 or so pages

WE SIGNED THE FANCY PAPERS! :D
Ope, I haven't forgotten about yall! The time has finally come! This Friday, Tumo and I finalized the deal with the publisher!! This means that we can move forward with fulfilling the Kickstarter promises.

Hi everyone, 
I have some very exciting news, but first, I have a small request. I know that I have not been great with updates. A lot of my time has been spent waiting for publisher to finalize the contract so that I know how much I can put out to y'all. I should've been better at communicating and I apologize for that and I will be better in the future. However, please do not send me messages with swears or talk poorly about my team. I've had rude comments on Kickstarter, email, and even my private Facebook.

updates.update_userinfo: A Request and Some Exciting News
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone, 
Thank you all that sent in their surveys. The responses have been coming in pretty quickly and I appreciate that so much. 88 percent of the surveys are done, but I really need that last 12 percent so that I can start ordering the various rewards! 
You guys are killing the survey game though. I am glad that I got so many responses so quickly. I've heard some horror stories of surveys not getting filled out for a whole year! I want to get at least 95% of the surveys or so. That way my ordering numbers are as close as possible. :)

project_data.project_name: The Bone Herder - An Afropunk Fantasy Horror Comic

campaign.story:
Series One from The Magic Puzzle Company is a set of three new 1,000-piece jigsaw puzzles with original art and a magical surprise at the end.
We set out to create the most entertaining jigsaw puzzle you’ve ever done by combining the traditional jigsaw puzzle experience with ideas from the worlds of tabletop games and magic.
We commissioned incredible, original art from independent artists, designed from the very beginning to be used in a jigsaw puzzle
We designed a surprise ending using techniques from optical illusions and magic that adds an extra experience to the end of the puzzle
Each puzzle has over 50 easter eggs to find as you solve (and they come with a guide to help)
Each puzzle is 28" x 21", and has 1000 pieces. That's about 4% larger than the normal size of a 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle.
We imported the highest-quality puzzle cardboard in the world (1.9mm Eska "blue" stock) from the Netherlands and invented some new printing techniques so the pieces snap together and stay snapped
These puzzles have been extensively playtested to make the experience as smooth and engaging as possible from the moment you open the box to the moment you place the last piece of the last segment
When you're done with the puzzle, everything can be reset and all of the secret compartments close back up with velcro so you can share the puzzle with a friend or solve it again later.
No puzzle dust!!
Puzzle Art
Most puzzles start with stock art of some trees or cats or something. We wanted each of our puzzles to make a fantastic, tiny world. And we wanted the art to tell a story as you solve it. So we worked closely with independent artists like Sarah Becan, Boya Sun, and Felicia Chiao to create beautiful one-of-a-kind puzzle images loaded with tiny details, story quirks, and easter eggs.
"The Happy Isles" by Sarah Becan
"The Mystic Maze" by Boya Sun
"The Sunny City" by Felicia Chiao
Custom Dielines
To make the magical ending work right, we had to customize the shape of every single piece in all three puzzles. While we were at it, we also made sure that the individual puzzle-piece shapes highlighted the cool art details instead of cutting them in half.
Jigsaw puzzles start as one big piece of cardboard, and then a specially designed cutting tool called a die comes down like a stamp and slices it into a thousand pieces.
The die for the "Happy Isles" puzzle
Usually, the tolerance for that slice is about 3mm. But to pull off the magical ending in our Series One puzzles, we needed a 0.5mm tolerance. Nobody had done that before, so we had to work closely with our puzzle factory create new quality-control and die-cutting techniques to make it happen. Some of the roughly 3,000 blades that make up our dies actually had to be precise to within 0.1mm — 30 times more precise than a regular puzzle. 
An excerpt from Simon’s briefing for the puzzle factory
 One of the nice side effects of making a more precise die and using super high-quality puzzle cardboard is the pieces click together in a really satisfying way and stay together even if you need to move the puzzle.  
 Magical Surprise 
It’s always exciting to pick up a new puzzle with an image you like and then open the box and start putting together the corners and edges. But after a while, you get to the part of the puzzle where you need to assemble 400 pieces of blurry sky. And then when the puzzle's about 75% done, that feeling of “what am I doing with my time” creeps in. Eventually the last piece finally goes in and the puzzle is over. We’ve always found that part a little anticlimactic.
So we came up with a whole new way for a puzzle to end. When you place the last piece of what you thought was the end of the puzzle, you unlock a whole new part of the experience — a final act that includes both a magical illusion and a completion to the puzzle's narrative. We playtested these puzzles hundreds of times with people all over the world to figure out how to make this special ending as clear and engaging as possible, and we hope you're going to love it.
"The Happy Isles" 1000-piece puzzle
"The Mystic Maze" 1000-piece puzzle
"The Sunny City" 1000-piece puzzle
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're working with our long-time manufacturing partner Ad Magic to deliver these puzzles to you on time. We've done our best to secure freight in advance of launching this project, and our factory is still operating. But it's possible that Coronavirus will bring global logistics to a standstill. We will be transparent in our communications and keep you in the loop as we work to get these puzzles made and shipped to your house.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
Each puzzle is designed to be re-packaged and gifted or solved again when you're done. All of the secret compartments and sleeves re-seal with velcro or string ties.
Sustainable materials
Our puzzles are printed on 100% recycled, FSC-certified cardboard to minimize the environmental impact of our printing, and there is NO single-use plastic inside of the box.

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
Jordan and Simon here with a backer update on the Magic Puzzles. We’ve shifted all of our resources into manufacturing, and we are on target with our original timeline to deliver the puzzles to you in October.
When we get closer to our shipping deadline, we will send you a Kickstarter Backer Survey to collect your most up-to-date mailing address and your puzzle selection (if you need to make a choice). We haven’t asked anyone for an address yet, so please don’t be concerned!

Hey friends,
Thank you so much for supporting the first series of Magic Puzzles on Kickstarter. The response to these puzzles is overwhelming, and we are humbled and grateful for your support. We are going to do everything we can do surprise and delight you with these puzzles - as well as get them to you quickly and professionally.
Since we are already getting inundated with messages on Kickstater and social media, I wanted to go over what happens next and answer some common questions.

project_data.project_name: Magic Puzzles

campaign.story:
Hi, I'm Djamila Knopf, an illustrator from Germany. You may know me from Instagram or Twitter.
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out this Kickstarter for my very first art book! The title of this book is Komorebi, Japanese for "sunlight filtering through trees", which I believe perfectly sums up the magical feeling I want to evoke with my work. I craft detailed illustrations imbued with a hint of magic and nostalgia to tell stories and celebrate my love for nature and Japanese animation. 
Although I share my work online, Komorebi is by far the most personal thing I have ever made. Across its pages, this book brings you a collection of the artwork I have created over the last three years, as well as providing insight into my thought processes and workflow. I will be sharing my early influences and personal journey of becoming an artist, and you will also find sketchbook pages, tutorials, and five brand new illustrations that I've created especially for this book. 
I wanted this book to be as beautiful as it can be, and that's why I teamed up with 3dtotal Publishing. I feel a lot better having an expert by my side for a project of this scope. I have The Art of Loish and The Art of Heikala on my bookshelf and I absolutely love them, so I'm really excited that 3dtotal has given me the opportunity to create an engaging and sensitively designed book that showcases my art in the best way possible.
I hope you consider backing this project and help me make this book become a reality.
Thank you!

Below are the exclusive items that are available in addition to the book. Some tiers and gifts are limited, so be sure to pledge quickly if you don’t want to miss out!
Please note that as this is a live project, all designs are examples of content I would like to include but these are subject to change.






Launching this book through Kickstarter allows us to thank those who make this book possible by adding extra stretch goal rewards to the campaign. I have designed high-quality bonus rewards to be given away if the project meets certain targets!






Stretch goals are available to all backers from Tier 1 and above. Please note: final designs of items are subject to change.


3dtotal publishing is committed to having a positive effect on the environment. From 2020 they have committed to planting one tree for every book they sell by partnering with re-forestation charities. This includes books sold in their Kickstarter campaigns. If you support this campaign we would like to thank you for helping us take on this mission.

3dtotal Publishing is able to ship worldwide! Simply select your pledge option and your location, and Kickstarter will calculate the shipping for you.
All rewards will be sent out at the same time (both signed and unsigned). However, if there is a very high number of backers, please keep in mind that it will take us a few days to work our way through packaging all the rewards. 3dtotal Publishing has a fulfilment company lined up to do this as quickly as possible, so once dispatched, rewards should reach you in 10-15 working days.
We have fulfilled many successful Kickstarters and we have a great record for delivering parcels around the world. For this campaign we will be offering tracked shipping to certain locations as we're really determined that you receive your parcel first time without any hiccups or problems with delivery. Parcels sent to the UK, USA and Europe will be sent using our regular and reliable service, and parcels sent to the rest of the world will be sent with tracked shipping. Due to complications to logistics caused by the Coronavirus, some countries have introduced surcharges to receiving international postage. This is why shipping prices will seem slightly higher for some backers than it has done on our past campaigns.
Unforeseen delays that are out of our control can occur during delivery, so please allow an additional two weeks before checking up on your package. We will be doing our best to make sure everything gets to you on time!


 For those who are not familiar with Kickstarter, it’s a worldwide crowd-funding platform for artists and their creative projects. Once the funding period ends, we will start finalizing the book and the extra rewards, which will be sent to you in September. About a month before that, we will send you a survey through Kickstarter, asking for your address – the reason we wait until a few weeks before is so that we have everyone’s most up-to-date details. When the survey is ready for you to fill in, you will receive an email through Kickstarter. We ask that you fill the survey in as soon as possible, to avoid any delays in sending out your reward!
              As seasoned users of Kickstarter, 3dtotal Publishing know that a very small number of backers don’t fill in the survey at the end of a Kickstarter campaign, making it impossible for us to process and ship their rewards. 3dtotal pledges to hold all rewards for backers that fail to fill in their survey for 12 months and to make multiple efforts to contact the backers in question to try to successfully deliver their items.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of the biggest challenges will be producing and delivering everything to you on time. We've selected an expert printer to work with and a fulfilment company 3dtotal Publishing has an established relationship with, so everything is in place as much as possible to ensure smooth production and delivery by the end of September 2020.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: New Kickstarter project - Rêverie: The Art of Sibylline Meynet
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
We thought you may be interested to know that our latest Kickstarter project is now live! We have teamed up with illustrator and character designer Sibylline Meynet to publish her first artbook, Rêverie: The Art of Sibylline Meynet.

updates.update_userinfo: Windows to Worlds: The Art of Devin Elle Kurtz is now live on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
We hope you are all keeping well! We thought you may be interested to hear about our new Kickstarter project, Windows to Worlds: The Art of Devin Elle Kurtz.

updates.update_userinfo: Find Djamila's stunning work in Earth Draw III - and help us protect rainforests
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
We hope you are all well!
As well as creating inspiring and informative art books, we are also committed to helping the planet and the people who inhabit it, and since 2018 we have run a yearly creative crowdfunding project called Earth Draw to raise funds for environmental charities.

updates.update_userinfo: TANK - new project live on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, 
We hope you are all keeping safe and well. We wanted to share our latest Kickstarter project with you, we are very excited to have teamed up with prolific visual effects studio Aaron Sims Creative, the team responsible for the iconic monsters of Stranger Things, for their first narrative artbook TANK.

Hi everyone,
We hope you are all well! We thought you may be interested in our latest Kickstarter project, we have teamed up with concept artist and illustrator Atey Ghailan for his first art book Atey Ghailan: An Artistic Journey.

Hi everyone,
We did it! The campaign is now over, and we are incredibly grateful to each and every one of you who has helped make this project a great success! We'd like to say a huge thank you to everyone who backed the campaign, shared it with family and friends, and supported Djamila in making this book become a reality.

campaign.story:
In 2019, AdorkaBows self-funded the production of Magical Bow Enamel Pins Set 1 as a supplement to their beautiful selection of one-of-a-kind, handmade, hair bows. These charming 1.5" pins feature bow-inspired art with various themes and colors.
Set 1 was was first released for sale in a private group in January 2020. This 6 pin set featured the themes of Water, Fire, Love, Flower, Justice, and Princess.
Set 2 will feature the themes: Sea, Wind, Time, Revolution, Protection, and Sweet. Your help is needed to bring this beautiful new set into production! 
Mock ups of Set 2 Pin Designs
 Backers will receive: 
Grade A (best quality) pins 
rubber backings
optional collector's cards & organza bag packaging (you will be able to opt into these through the backer survey)
FREE GIFT 1.5" Special Edition Diestruck Antique Gold pin
Backers at $60+ will also get a FREE Limited Edition 2020 AdorkaBows 1.5" Diestruck Coin
TIMELINE
GOALS
Thanks for the enthusiastic support in unlocking the three main goals and ALL the stretch goals!  ✨♥ 
Pin Selection
Backers can choose from the following pins: any Set 1, any Set 2, and unlocked stretch goals! 
Backers with multiple pin rewards can opt to include duplicate pins, if they want. 
Mix and match or create full sets! Your backer survey will have places to let me know your choices.
Add On Shop
Add-on shop is done in place of having multiple item tiers to make customization of your rewards easier. Increase your overall pledge amount to add items from the Add On Shop!
There will be an area in the backer survey for you to list which items you've added. For example, if you have a backer level of $12 with free USA shipping but want to add both sticker sheets, add $10 to you pledge for a total of $22. 
Items may be added to this shop as the funding progresses so check back occasionally! 
STICKERS - One Sheet (A or B) add $6ea, Two Sheets add $10 (sticker sheets are included for free in the $100+ tiers) Additional shipping is included. 
ADDITIONAL PIN - add $12 per pin (any unlocked designs, any Set 1 designs) Additional shipping is included. 
DIESTRUCK ANTIQUE PIN - add $10 per pin (Every backer gets one free but if you want extras you can add on)
LIMITED EDITION 2020 COLLECTOR'S COIN -  Free for every backer $60+, available as an add-on $10 per coin
Thank you for much for your time and consideration of my new project! ♥  Please help spread the word to other people so we can unlock more pins! In the name of the Moon, let's PIN!
Twitter ♥ Facebook ♥ Instagram ♥ Facebook Sales Group
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Once funds have cleared 15 days after the Kickstarter ends, the pins will go to production. When they arrive to AdorkaBows, there will be a quality check on them before careful packing and shipping to all backers. 

This project uses established manufacturing relationships with a history of quality and timeliness. The situation regarding the worldwide spread of the coronavirus has caused some delays in our personal lives and in manufacturing industries, so I have set the delivery estimations with these potential continued delays in mind.

Backers will be updated regularly through Kickstarter on the progress of the project and manufacturing.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Until and unless I launch another project in the future, this should be the last update for this project.
All Backer Rewards and pre-orders have been shipped. I cross checked my shipping list with the Backer list to confirm all packages have been sent. If you live in the USA and you don't get your rewards by July 1, please message me. International backers should give a 2-4 week transit buffer.

I finished packing all Kickstarter orders just now! 🎉
If you didn't get a tracking email, please message me and I can get the info for you manually. 
I'm taking a few days off packing then I will start packing the pre-order shipments. 
I'm hoping to have the online store open within the first two weeks of July. I will make one last update with the store info here when it launches, but my Facebook Group, AdorkaBows Select Bow-Peeks will have first dibs on the new shop as well as a brand new Limited Edition design drop!

Hi all! I figure once a week is a reasonable check in til we're done? :D
Packages are 55% shipped! I had a small delay with the Special Edition cards coming in, and now I've blown through all the standard edition cards, but the refill for that has already shipped so I can't make it any faster. It should be here mid-week or so, then I can continue shipping.
There's not been any specific order that shipments have been going out. Because I'm packing them on my own around my family's schedule, I've been just grabbing and doing them as I can (lots of time? pack some big orders! Got 15 min? Pack some 1 pin orders!) I know this means people who backed early or backed at high levels might be waiting a little longer for rewards, which can be frustrating. I planned to have a lot of help with this part of the project but alas - that was not to be!

Hi all!
Packages are 26% shipped! 🎉 
Due to a small oversight on my part, the backing cards for the Special Edition pins are running a little late. I've paid to expedite their print and shipment but I still won't have them until mid week. Due to this, I began shipping orders that had opted for 'no cards' first.

THE PINS ARE HERE!!!!

updates.update_content:
Hi all! Thanks for being patient! The pins have shipped from the factory and they are en route to me. I will be issuing the charge card order through Backer Kit this FRIDAY MAY 29th at 9AM. I am not sure if it will process immediately or with 48 hour notice, but this is serving as your 48 hour notice just in case it's immediate. ♥
This charge only applies to people who did add-ons through BackerKit or preorders. 
When the pins get here I will be kicking it into high gear to count, photograph and sort them. I will be shipping orders out as fast as I can, but please expect delays as I am home full time with my kiddo and still doing homeschooling because schools are closed.

First, the stuff that looks good:
Hi all! Since it's been about a week, I wanted to give you an update. The coins and die struck pins are here. They're lovely and I'm super excited.

campaign.story:
Saint Louis, Missouri, 1920. Prohibition, the Constitutional ban on the sale of alcohol in the United States, comes into effect.... And business couldn't be better at the Little Daisy Cafe.
But things aren't what they seem. Atlas May, proprietor, uses the charming little restaurant as a front for his real cash cow; the Lackadaisy speakeasy, where flashing the club symbol from a deck of cards grants everykitty in-the-know access to more moonshine than they could ever drink. Life is good... Until Atlas is murdered in cold blood.
Now, it's 1927. Mitzi, Atlas' widow, struggles to keep Lackadaisy afloat, as the patrons drift away and a skeleton crew of staff sticks by her side. Scrappy young musician/rum-runner Rocky Rickaby, his wide-eyed but tightly-wound cousin Freckle McMurray, and the endlessly resourceful and sharp-tongued Ivy Pepper, heiress to the quickly-dwindling Lackadaisy fortune, are forced to make do in a world of increasingly unfriendly competition, intent on shooting, smuggling, and conspiring their way back to a successful bar, against all odds. 
Lackadaisy Cats has been running online since 2006, immersing its readership in a world of sepia-toned crime, adventure, action, and comedy. And now, it's ready for its next big move... to a screen near you.
Why a cartoon? Why now?
There's never been more interest in adult animation, with shows like Bojack Horseman, Big Mouth, and Primal capturing the attention and imaginations of millions of viewers. 
Lackadaisy is an exceptional webcomic, but in her mind, Tracy has always pictured it as an animated film. It’s a side effect, perhaps, of a childhood nourished on Looney Tunes, Disney, and Don Bluth features; a dream of sharing that living, breathing, musical version of Lackadaisy with its dedicated readership. But the when-and-how something like that could ever be achieved has always lacked an obvious ingress.
As the 20s dawn upon us again, with new animation tools and techniques available, with talented and excited artists on deck an raring to get to work, and with the internet eager for more independently-created media, the auspiciousness seems writ-large - splashed across an art deco picture palace marquee, if you will. 
Now’s the time.
The Lackadaisy animated short proposes a 10-minute, fun-and-action-filled adventure, full of car chases, shootout, sass, and  un-requested violin solos. And with your help, we can make it happen!
The finished short will be available for everyone to watch!
Meet the people in charge of (and contributing to) the project! 
A former game dev, illustrator and graphic designer, Tracy Butler began Lackadaisy after researching the history of her century-old Saint Louis home, and being inspired by her love of jazz music and 1920s aesthetics. Boasting over 1,600 backers on Patreon, Lackadaisy has been her full-time job for years, garnering a dedicated readership of thousands. As the creator of the comic, Tracy will play a role as co-director on the animated short, as well as overseeing art direction.
Fable Siegel is a veteran animation professional, boasting a resume that includes Titmouse, Starburns, the internet phenomenon Hazbin Hotel, and two Game Grumps Animated shorts, along with storyboard work for Cartoon Network (Ben 10), Stoopid Monkey (Adam Ruins Everything: Reanimated History), Warner Brothers (Wacky Races), Shadow Machine (F is for Family), and more, as well as being a board artist, animator, and designer for Six Point Harness (Like Share Die).  Brought onto the Lackadaisy animated short as a production manager, director, and producer, they'll be overseeing the project utilizing their years of professional experience and skill.
 Our awesome line-up of talent, in no particular order:
 Michael Kovach  (@kovox) as Rocky Rickaby! 
 Belsheber Rusape (@BelRusapeVO) as Calvin "Freckle" McMurray! 
 Lisa Reimold (@lisareimold)  as Ivy Pepper! 
 Ashe Wagner (@TheQueenViking)  as Mitzi May! 
and SungWon Cho (@ProZD) as Mordecai Heller! 
Character Design
Tai (@corvidmonster)
3D Modeling
Zachary "Newt" Nall (https://www.noneuclideandesigns.com/)
Storyboard Artist
Ashley "Kilomonster" Green (@AshGMonstrology)
Sound Direction
M. Gewehr (@MWGewehr)
Theme Music
Sepiatonic (https://www.facebook.com/sepiatonic/)
Violinist
Ameryln Zeta (@amenemone)
Wondering what awards await you if you decide to back the project? Look no further!
Lackadaisy Essentials is the primary means by which we intend to fund the animated short, and Iron Circus Comics' part in this incredibly ambitious project! Planned as a hardcover volume of about 100 pages, Lackadaisy Essentials contains never-before-published minicomics, one-offs, sketches, and other creative work by Tracy, delving into the world and details of the Lackadaisy webcomic.
 Lackadaisy Volumes 1 & 2 ebooks are the collected Lackadaisy webcomic! Grab the tiers including this reward to read the comic offline at your leisure, at a beautiful, high resolution!
Want to see the finished product in its snazziest, most high-quality form? Back a tier that grants access to an HD download of the finished animated short! The Lackadaisy short will be a fully-polished final product, professionally animated, voice-acted, and scored by musical and animation professionals!
 There's so much that goes into making a cartoon. Storyboards, animatics, a soundtrack, 3D models! Back at the Goodie Bag level and higher to grab all these cool bits 'n' pieces. The perfect backer level for folks who wanna see how the sausage is made. Higher levels even grant special thanks in the credits!
 ALL IN! Really wanna become an indispensable part of the project? Maybe even make animation history? The very highest tiers of support grant in-story cameos, personalized Lackadaisy-sona designs, original art from Tracy and the crew, and MORE. 
 There's something available at practically every level of support!
 $85,000 is the minimum we would need to make sure this one-of-a-kind project comes to fruition. But in case we overfund, we already have some awesome plans to make this Kickstarter even better.

And our final two stretch goals...

Whatever you may decide, thanks for getting this far down the page, and reading all about this new venture! We hope to see you on the other side in 2021, with the very first Iron Circus Animation!

This is Iron Circus Comics' TWENTY-FOURTH Kickstarter project. Twenty-one of our previous projects have been fulfilled and completed, and the rest are currently in progress. Our track record speaks for itself!

updates.update_userinfo: SNEAK PEEK: The Shot Glass Sets Are SOLD OUT, And Production Is UNDERWAY!
updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone, and Happy Monday! Spike here, just checking in with some in-progress shots of our now sold out Lackadaisy shot glass sets! 
(If you ordered a set of Lackadaisy shot glasses: thank you so, so much! The proceeds of their sale are going directly towards further support of the production of the animated short!)
Just so everyone knows: We're currently regarding the sets as "sold out," and will offer no more for sale for the foreseeable future. However, we are holding back a few sets in case any already purchased are lost or broken in the mail, as just-to-be-safe replacements. If we have any left over from that stack after the dust settles, we have some final, few sets to offer  a few months down the line. But no promises, and no guarantees!

updates.update_userinfo: Fewer than 100 Lackadaisy shot glass sets remain! Also: Please vote in our poll!
updates.update_content:
Hey again, folks! Spike, here. Hope you're ready for a fun weekend!
Our weekend over at Iron Circus is definitely going to be a good one, because we're in full on celebration mode, over here!
As of this very moment, fewer than 100 Lackadaisy shot glass sets remain available for purchase!!!

updates.update_userinfo: ONE YEAR IN: Where do we stand?
updates.update_content:
Hey again, everyone! Spike from Iron Circus here, with a long-awaited, much-anticipated update. Sorry to keep ya hangin'!
Just a few days ago,we passed the one-year anniversary of the Lackadaisy Short Film Kickstarter.  And lemme tell ya, it has been an absolutely WILD year. I'll try to review it all in as efficient a manner as I'm able!
The Little Daisy Cafe, our Kickstarter stretch goal production blog, continues to update,  with the latest post going up just this past Monday! It's a 6th sneak-peek at in-production animation roughs,

Hey, all. Spike here.
Don't get too excited, this is a quick, li'l, Kickstarter-mandated update.
This account was founded in 2009, the year Kickstarter launched, under the name "IronSpike." The name I used everywhere, so that was only natural.
However, in the last 12 years? It's grown into something far beyond just me. Iron Circus Comics, formerly just a glorified self-publishing DBA, has grown into a small-mid graphic novel publishing house, the largest of its kind in Chicago, possibly the entire Midwest.

updates.update_userinfo: NOW AVAILABLE FOR PRE-ORDER: Limited Edition Lackadaisy SHOT GLASS SETS!
updates.update_content:
Hey there, folks! Spike here, again.  And today is a day we over here in the House of Lackadaisy are only too happy to observe!
If you've been keeping up with our production blog, The Little Daisy Cafe (which has just had a big update of fan art, production sneak-peeks, and goofy crew memes!), maybe you'd like to acknowledge it, too!
Because today is the birthday of Clint Pereira, Lackadaisy production assistant, note-keeper, blog-updater, and all-around course-corrector in an administrative capacity! We couldn't function without him, and we're so happy to have him aboard!

Hey all, Spike here again!
And I come bearing GIFTS.
In cased you missed it, linked here is the FULL Lackadaisy Pancake-Trip, featuring Dancakes! This four-hour stream is full of amazing pancake art, and definitely qualifies as one of the weirdest and most wonderful iterations of Lackadaisy yet.

updates.update_userinfo: Makin' DAN cakes, makin' kitty DAN cakes! ~♪
updates.update_content:
Clarification to the latest update: Tracy is still working on some of the reward artwork for the higher tier backers - if you haven't received your art yet, we didn't forget you! Work is still underway and you can email Tracy for an update if you wish. We are ready to start collecting requests from the $280 tier backers, though, as the last update stated, so that Tracy has the information needed to get started on them as soon as possible.
-Fable

updates.update_userinfo: Revision to SUPER-UPDATE: on reward art and tiers
updates.update_content:
Hey again, folks! Long time, no update. Spike here again, hoping everyone is holding up as well as they're able! We've got a WHOLE BUNCH to cover, so let's just get right to it!
Tracy Butler, creator of Lackadaisy, and Fable Siegel, the Lackadaisy animated short's project manager and director, will be on a (virtual) panel at the online version of Further Confusion this Saturday, January 16th, at 5:00 PM Pacific! Just $10 a head, sign up while there's still room and sit in on their chat about making an animated short from scratch, with an all-online virtual studio! Register here!

updates.update_userinfo: SUPER-UPDATE: Book sneak-peek! Art and announcements! Date changes and Further Confusion!
updates.update_content:
Hey again, folks, Spike, here! And we've got a new bonus available for everyone who's looking forward to the Lackadaisy short film!
On Gumroad, right this moment, for free/pay-what-you-like:  The Lackadaisy Character Designs Pack!

project_data.project_name: Lackadaisy: The Animated Short Film

campaign.story:
Hi everyone! Thank you for deciding to click on this link and land on this page. Unfortunately, our campaign has coincided with the Covid-19 outbreak, which makes it a little awkward to be asking for help right now. Thank you so much for supporting the arts during this time and pushing for the stories we need from marginalized groups for our history and cultural growth. Every day we are thinking of our first responders, medical professionals, couriers, grocers, cleaning professionals, and anyone on the frontlines fighting to save lives. Thank you for keeping us safe. Please check in on your loved ones and be kind to yourselves during this crisis. Thank you again for choosing to support our film. Hopefully it can bring you a little sunshine when it's finished.
With love, the "And Then" team. 
See all of the unlocked stretch goals below!
Mana and Haru
AND THEN is a short film about two women who meet in Tokyo and grow closer to each other through insomnia, discovering Tokyo together, and their shared love of art. We are looking to crowdfund the cost of post-production, including editing, music, sound mixing, color grading, festival submissions, possible re-shoots and associated rental and production costs, and other costs to finish the film. The more money we raise, the better the film we can make. Principal filming was done in 3.5 days and finished in February 2020 in Tokyo, Japan. The film and spans across Taito City, Asakusabashi, Asakusa, Shizouka Prefecture, Shinjuku, and Shibuya. The project is led by JENN RAVENNA, a queer Asian-American director and cinematographer with roots in the video game entertainment industry. 
Mana wandering the streets of Tokyo alone
While the video will be submitted to film festivals first, the final video will be delivered to backers once the festival season is over at a date to be determined. As the film is currently in-process with an editor, it is also possible the film will be delayed in the event we need to return to Tokyo to film additional scenes, depending on the success of the campaign. Physical rewards will be delivered sooner.
ABOUT AND THEN 
Mana and Haru at Shibuya Crossing
AND THEN is a story about missed connections, loneliness, adventure, longing to be accepted, art, finding purpose, and the possibility of reconnecting with those we've lost touch with. The short film follows Mana, a Japanese-American woman who arrives in Tokyo seeking to find a break from her life as an artist, and Haru, a Japanese woman from the countryside who dreams of becoming an artist herself one day. They meet under unique circumstances, and their story unfolds. It's a story that is not often seen in mainstream cinema: a queer Asian and Asian-American love story.
Mana and Haru
The film began as a possible project idea during the director's stay at an artist residency in Tokyo. As the director became more committed to film-making and cinematography, and more aware of the challenges of  representation in narrative cinema, the idea soon solidified into an international independent film production. 
Join us on this whimsical, serendipitous love story about two women  who find each other on the streets of Tokyo
Mana and Haru at Shinsen Station
Many of the talent and crew members volunteered their time to the film, as they also believed in the story and the need for more representation on screen. Local Japanese businesses also generously offered their resources and spaces to the production. 
Mana and Haru in Shinjuku
BUDGET BREAKDOWN
Currently, the film production is entirely self-funded by Jenn Ravenna. So far production costs have totaled over $31,300.
A breakdown of film production costs already spent for principal filming
3/12/2020 EDIT: Above diagram does NOT include insurance which was $3,705 alone. This means Jenn put out over $31,300 of her personal savings + available credit to kick-start the film. 
We are crowdfunding the remaining $15,000 for the same reason we are making "AND THEN": to be able to tell our own narratives. Crowdfunding is the best way to ensure that the talent and production team - both in front of and behind the camera - have full control over their story, credited accordingly, and ensuring the work is produced and shared in a timely manner.
We are asking for an additional $15,000 for post-production and finishing costs, including editing, music production, color-grading, festival fees, the possible event that we may need to return to Tokyo re-shoot scenes and add pick-up shots, and to relieve Jenn of some  financial burdens accumulated from the production. The more money we raise, the better the film will be.
Mikans - a reoccurring symbol
Should the Kickstarter become wildly successful, the dream would be to fully recover all production costs, back pay the crew and talent who generously donated their time, contribute to funds to continuing education and film gear for crew members, and to set up a small scholarship fund at ALMOST PERFECT for future creative residents. 
4/8/2020 Update: Estimated Budget Allocation should the Kickstarter reach 100K.
THE REWARDS
NEW TIER: DIRECTOR'S CHAIR will include a custom wooden USB drive with all digital content and the film, plus surprise bonus content.
Custom USB with the Film!
STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED: Every $65 backer and above will receive a Cosmic Pride Enamel Pin designed by Jenn Ravenna.
This was a stretch goal that was unlocked when we reached $55K!

You have the option of hand embellishments, or a painting or sketch on the back of the Monotype if canvas is chosen. The certificate of authenticity will state that I will never print the Monotype on specified materials ever again.
